newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila's PHIBOR market closed for the holidays.
newsitem.headline: Manila's PHIBOR market closed for the holidays.

text.p: The market for Philippine interbank offered rates (PHIBOR) is closed on Thursday and Friday. Trading will resume on Monday.
PHIBOR rates were mostly higher on Wednesday following the 0.25 percentage-point increase in the U.S. interest rate.
PHIBOR represents rates at which banks would be willing to swap their pesos for dollars.
